replies.body:
Well, It depends on the storage: A 32GB unlocked S6 costs around the £550 mark, and a 16GB unlocked iPhone costs £540. (For Europeans.) If you for go for the top 128GB models, the S6 will cost you roughly £730 in comparison to the iPhone 6, which is around £680.
As shown here: http://www.trustedreviews.com/opinions/samsung-galaxy-s6-vs-iphone-6
In the U.S the prices have about the same difference between them.

replies.body:
A comparison video of both phones

If you do not like apple or just want to see someone blend the iphone 6 click here!

tbh I like androids better. Would recommend that, I just feel that apple thinks way too much of themselves and give out too much bullshit.
Say for example, a few years ago Apple said that their systems are unhackable. Many people proved them wrong and hacked many of other people's systems through downloads and shit, the customers went complaining to the company.
Then there is android, not giving out bullshit, not saying any bullshit. I trust Android better than Apple on that point of view.
In the feel of holding the phones, until now I've seen that all Android phones have a much better feel to it than the Apple phones when holding.
And last but not least... Want to get a game for free that costs money? Instead of jail breaking your apple phone that ruins the warranty get an Android, use 4shared, and tada, you got your game for free. You can always root your Android phone for more features (recording on it, e.t.c.) but there are apps that allow you to connect you're phones screen to your laptop/computer so you can record from your computer but play from your phone.

In short form:
Android > Apple

replies.body: I have to agree with you on how poor iCloud's security is. In terms of how good it feels when you hold it in your hand, that's more of an opinion, and there are factors such as the size of the phone and the case that you're using. Jailbreaking voids warranty, sure, but it can easily be reverted, and Apple employees can't be bothered to check. You can also connect an iPhone to the computer and record the device's screen from there.

replies.body:
Hello. 

Hi.

Controversial opinion coming through.

Between the two, I'm going to say Galaxy S6. BUT. 

ONE - I would never buy one, samsung ew. 

TWO - Overall, in terms of specs, features and overall functionality samsung comes out on top.

THREE - iOS has become boring (imo) which has led me to believe that android 5.0 might be something I'll invest in in the future (got a 5s now, its great, but I'm bored).

replies.body: M8 go for the OnePlus by OnePlusOne. It is the top phone right now and fairly cheap.
replies.body_tagged: M8 go for the OnePlus by OnePlusOne. It is the top phone right now and fairly cheap.

replies.body:
Define what is better in your opinion. 

The iPhone is far superior for user friendly interface. People also typically notice faster web browsing on iPhones compared to androids.

The S6 however, is far more powerful. It has a higher resolution screen (1440p) while the iphone 6 is only 750p. The s6 will perform faster for just about everything, except maybe web browsing. The s6 also has a much higher resolution camera capability at 16mp, compare to the iphones 8mp. The s6 also has a better secondary camera at 5mp compared to the iphones 1.2mp. The s6 has a better processor and 3 times the amount of ram. The s6 is much, much more powerfu than an iphone, and android also offers more freedom and modding options.

So, if you want an easy to use phone, get the iphone 6. 
If you want a phone to perform well, work very fast, take good photos and videos, and be able to mod the software, take an s6.

You get A LOT more performance from the s6 for the price.
